course_title: Studies in African American Literature: 1900 to Present
class_notes:
Course Topic: Toni Morrison: the Image and the Ancestor as Foundation


This course explores Toni Morrison's use of an image as an impetus, as well as an ancestral lineage for a selection of her novels. This course surveys a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in a selection of Morrison's novels. The required fiction of Toni Morrison texts for this course includes Beloved (1987), Jazz (1992), Paradise (1998), and A Mercy (2008). Course requirements include one review of secondary criticism, analytical responses, and a term paper, including an annotated bibliography and oral presentation.
course_description: A topics course dealing with major traditions and issues in African American literature from 1900 to the present. Possible topics include passing and miscegenation, black novels since 1950, Afrofuturism, and black theater.
